article:
'Ruthenium' is a chemical element with symbol 'Ru' and atomic number 44. It is a
rare transition metal belonging to the platinum group of the periodic table.
Like the other metals of the platinum group, ruthenium is inert to most
chemicals. The Baltic German scientist Karl Ernst Claus discovered the element
in 1844 and named it after Ruthenia, the Latin word for Rus'. Ruthenium usually
occurs as a minor component of platinum ores and its annual production is only
about 20 tonnes. [http://www.platinum.matthey.com/uploaded_files/Pt2009/09summary.pdf
Summary. Ruthenium]. platinum.matthey.com, p. 9 (2009) Most ruthenium is
used for wear-resistant electrical contacts and the production of thick-film
resistors. A minor application of ruthenium is its use in some platinum alloys.
